content: How can I achieve something similar to Python's list comprehension in JavaScript? Specifically, if I have a list of objects and I want to extract their names to a new list, how would I do this in a clean way in JavaScript? For instance, in Python I would do: `list_of_names = [x.name for x in list_of_objects]`. Moreover, using jQuery, if I have a jQuery selector like `$('input')` to get all `input` elements, how can I create an array of all the `name` attributes for each of these `input` elements--i.e., all of the `$('input').attr('name')` strings in an array?
